commitResults.messageTitle: Add Level-3 Mark as Done; Made program obey SRP
commitResults.messageBody:
Added the ability to mark Tasks as Done or Undone;
Split Yapper into more classes to handle one responsibility each:
1 Yapper initializes TaskManager and runs the UserInterface.
2 UserInterface chooses the instruction based on user input.
3 TaskManager handles the various tasks stored by the user.
4 InputStringHandler parses strings inputted by the user.
5 OutputStringHandler formats strings to output to the user.
6 Instruction handles the various instructions (implemented so far).
7 Task contains features of tasks such as description is done-ness.
8 CommonStrings contains important strings used in the program.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Level 4 ToDos, Events, Deadlines
commitResults.messageBody:
Modified code to include the 3 new Task subtypes:
Add taskToString() for all of Task, TaskTodo, TaskDeadline and TaskEvent
InputStringHandler can now parse the 3 new instructions
OutputStringHandler can now format the 3 new instructions
Instruction now includes the 3 new instruction types
UserInterface now handles the 3 new instruction types

commitResults.messageTitle: Renamed class that stores ChatBot speeches from CommonStrings to StringStorage.
commitResults.messageBody:
The old name was not representative of what it currently does.
Also modified the messages sent upon startup and shutdown, as I felt the old one was bad. The new one sounds better.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add find functionality to Yapper chatbot program, execution-wise (not parsing-wise)
commitResults.messageBody:
FIND lists all matching tasks (not just the top N), is case-sensitive (not case-insensitive), match substring (not match whole words) and searches description only (not start date or end date).
Add printTaskWithoutOrdinal and printTaskWithOrdinal methods to OutputStringHandler to adhere to SLAP, and also because similar patterns of code is found throughout OutputStringHandler
printAllTasks in OutputStringHandler used to use .get() which is a ArrayList method and not a List<Task> tasks method, so TaskManager is passed as an argument so that I can use getTaskOrdinal() or getTask() instead
Add printTasksMatchQuery method in OutputStringHandler to handle FIND, which follows the idea above
Edit printAllTasks and printTasksMatchQuery function calls in handleFindInstruction and handleListInstruction (in InstructionHandler) respectively
Add in FIND in handleInstruction method's match-case and a handleFindInstruction
Add FIND to InstructionType enum
Add 2 string constants related to finding in StringStorage class
